medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Sibling 1, a 15-month-old boy, presented after falling and fracturing his left wrist, with radiographic findings of widened physes and metaphyseal cupping. Laboratory data confirmed hypocalcemia at 7.9 mg/dl and secondary hyperparathyroidism. Sibling 2, a 4-day-old girl, had low serum calcium levels of 7.2 mg/dl at birth, which improved with formula feeding but showed hypocalcemia at 7 weeks with a serum calcium of 6.4 mg/dl, consistent with calcipenic rickets.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both siblings were compound heterozygous for two novel mutations in the CYP27B1 gene causing Vitamin D-dependent rickets type 1 (VDDR-1).
medical_history.family_history: Parents are nonconsanguineous and asymptomatic. Genetic testing of parents was not available.
medical_history.social_history: Sibling 1 was well-nourished, having been breastfed for 3 months before switching to vitamin D-fortified formula. Sibling 2 was feeding well at the time of the hypocalcemic episode.
